title: France riots: Nanterre rocked by killing and unrest
description: The town of Nanterre is shaken by nights of rioting after 17-year-old Nahel was shot by police.

title: Old Firm, new friends - the day that Celtic and Rangers played as one
description: Divided by history, rivalry and religion, but in 1959, for one night only, Celtic and Rangers came together to play as a combined XI. And the inspiration came from the depths of Loch Ness.

title: Rwanda asylum a risk to UK foreign policy, says ex-minister
description: Justine Greening tells BBC Newsnight domestic policy should not affect efforts to tackle human rights abuses.

title: Hugh Pym: Will the NHS staffing plan work?
description: Hugh Pym looks at whether the PM's workforce plan is the right way to fix problems in the health service.

title: Jeremy Clarkson's Meghan article was sexist to duchess, press regulator rules
description: A record 25,000 people complained about the piece, in which Clarkson said he "hated" the Duchess of Sussex.

title: Kenya lorry crash: Dozens killed after truck loses control
description: A local police commander fears people may be trapped underneath the toppled-over vehicle.

title: Tour de France 2023: Safety on everyone's mind, while Mark Cavendish & Peter Sagan say goodbye
description: After Gino Mader's death, safety is uppermost in people's minds at the beginning of the Tour de France - cycling's greatest race.

title: Australia legalises psychedelics for mental health
description: Approved psychiatrists can now prescribe MDMA and magic mushrooms for disorders like depression.

title: Sugababes: Women in music don't have to look perfect now
description: The band spoke before supporting "legendary musicians" Lionel Richie and Gabrielle in Chepstow.

title: Jack Mortimer: 'The only heroes are the ones that don't come back'
description: Jack Mortimer has never forgotten those who died trying to secure Sword Beach before he landed on D-Day.

title: Ashes 2023: Why England's Bazball style is starting to lose its shine
description: England's style of cricket has won many admirers but their Ashes approach is hurting the people who love them the most, says Stephan Shemilt.

title: Nicolas Jackson: Chelsea sign Senegal forward from Villarreal on eight-year contract
description: Chelsea complete the signing of Senegal forward Nicolas Jackson on an eight-year contract from Villarreal.

title: Youth worker loses damages fight after police Tasered him
description: Judge finds officer had 'objectively reasonable' belief the Tasering of Edwin Afriyie was necessary.

title: Cardiff City: Football club told to pay Sala transfer balance
description: It is believed Fifa has told the club to pay more than €11m (£9.45m) to cover the fee.

title: Ashes: England v Australia - second Test, day three highlights
description: England's hopes in the second Test and the Ashes hang by a thread following an awful third day against Australia at Lord's.

title: UK porn age checks raise privacy concerns
description: Digital rights groups say more robust age verification requirements lack transparency.

title: Austrian Grand Prix 2023: Max Verstappen on pole ahead of Charles Leclerc
description: Max Verstappen takes a comfortable pole position from Ferrari's Charles Leclerc at his Red Bull team's home race, the Austrian Grand Prix.

title: Moldova attack: Two dead as man opens fire inside Chisinau airport
description: The man was denied entry to Chisinau airport and then shot two officials, authorities say.

title: England captain Heather Knight gives ICEC report insight amid 'ironing' remark
description: England captain Heather Knight says cricket has made progress from the days she received sexist remarks about ironing but has "a long way to go" in the wake of a damning independent report.

title: The Ashes 2023: England hopes fading after Australia dominate at Lord's
description: England's hopes in the second Test and the Ashes hang by a thread after an awful third day against Australia at Lord's.

title: Paul Heaton pays for fans' drinks to mark Scarborough gig
description: The Beautiful South singer puts money behind the bar at pubs in Scarborough to thank fans.

title: Cancer patient regains ability to smile after innovative surgery
description: Daniel Kilty suffered with facial paralysis before undergoing the innovative operation in Portsmouth.

title: The Ashes: James Anderson removes Marnus Labuschagne for England's second wicket at Lord's
description: Marnus Labuschagne is dismissed for 30 by James Anderson as England pick up their second wicket on day three of the second Ashes Test at Lord's.

title: Eight-year election ban for Brazil's Jair Bolsonaro
description: Ex-president Jair Bolsonaro is barred from running for office by the top electoral court.

title: London Super Sewer gets underground flower garden
description: The artificial oasis 50m beneath London aims to reflect a healthier future for the River Thames once the new sewer opens.

title: Alan Arkin: Little Miss Sunshine actor dies aged 89
description: Arkin won an Oscar for playing the outrageous grandad in the 2006 film, and also appeared in Argo.

title: France shooting: Macron accuses rioters of exploiting teen killed by police
description: At a crisis meeting, France's president condemns three nights of riots as "unjustifiable".

title: Hacking trial: Prince Harry claims £320,000 in damages for 33 articles
description: The Duke of Sussex alleges articles published by Mirror Group Newspapers breached his privacy.

title: Covid pandemic linked to surge in child and teen diabetes
description: Experts have seen a 'substantial' yet unexplained rise in new cases worldwide since the pandemic.

title: Lucy Letby trial: Babies died 'due to care failures and not murder'
description: Murder-accused nurse Lucy Letby's barrister says there is "no direct evidence" she harmed anybody.

title: Man Utd keeper De Gea set to become a free agent
description: Manchester United goalkeeper David de Gea's contract will come to an end on Friday with no decision over whether he will remain at Old Trafford.

title: Anita Anand: Presenter interviews Canadian minister with same name
description: The BBC presenter and Canadian politician joke about all the times they have been mistaken for each other.

title: Sue Gray can start job with Labour from September
description: Some Tories were angry about the job offer for the ex-civil servant who wrote a report on Partygate.

title: The Ashes: David Warner dismissed lbw by Josh Tongue at Lord's
description: David Warner is dismissed lbw by Josh Tongue as England finally break through on day three of the second Ashes Test at Lord's.

title: Savannah Marshall a 'happier fighter' as she makes weight for bout with Franchon Crews-Dezurn
description: Savannah Marshall is "a happier fighter" at super-middleweight after comfortably weighing in for Saturday's undisputed world-title bout with Franchon Crews-Dezurn.

title: Jen Beattie: Arsenal defender signs new contract after overcoming cancer

description: Police are investigating reports of serious sexual assaults in a gender neutral toilet at a school.

title: Eastbourne International: Coco Gauff loses semi-final in straight sets to compatriot Madison Keys

title: Nutmeg co-founder Nick Hungerford sets up charity for bereaved children
description: Nick Hungerford's charity for bereaved children, Elizabeth's Smile, is named after his daughter.

description: The actor denies 12 charges covering sex assault allegations made by four men spanning more than a decade.

title: Woman who murdered baby son jailed for at least 20 years

description: England slump to 325 all out after losing six wickets for 47 runs in the morning session on day three of the second Ashes Test at Lord's.

title: Taylor Swift: Cruel Summer back in UK top 40 again four years later
description: Cruel Summer, from her 2019 album Lover, is Taylor's newest single, and set to rise up the charts.

description: Liverpool are in talks with RB Leipzig as they look into signing Hungary midfielder Dominik Szoboszlai from the German club.

description: Australia spinner Nathan Lyon suffered a "significant calf strain" on day two of the second Ashes Test and is a doubt for the rest of the series.

description: Two-time champion Andy Murray faces fellow Briton Ryan Peniston in an eye-catching Wimbledon first-round match.

title: SNP auditors say some financial records are missing
description: Records for some cash and cheques have been lost but the party says it is on track to file its accounts on time.

title: Poland charges Russian ice hockey player with spying
description: The suspect, a Russian national playing in Poland's major league, faces up to 10 years in prison.

title: Naomi Campbell becomes a mother for a second time, aged 53
description: The supermodel, who welcomed her first child two years ago, says 'it's never too late'.

title: Challenge to Covid inquiry over Johnson WhatsApps in court
description: The Cabinet Office and the inquiry chair are at loggerheads over Boris Johnson's WhatsApp messages.

title: England: Luke Cowan-Dickie out of World Cup selection because of injury
description: England hooker Luke Cowan-Dickie is out of World Cup because of a shoulder injury, says head coach Steve Borthwick.

title: June 2023 likely to be the UK's hottest on record
description: Provisional figures show June 2023 has surpassed 1940 and 1976.

title: Thailand: Rescuers amputate leg of woman stuck in travelator
description: Her family says they are shocked and saddened at the incident in Thailand's Don Mueang airport.

title: Zac Goldsmith resigns after criticism over Partygate probe

title: Champions Celtic host Ross County in Premiership opener
description: Celtic will begin the defence of the title at home to Ross County on Saturday, 5 August as the Scottish Premiership fixtures are revealed.

title: Mortgage applications steady despite rate rises, says Nationwide
description: Applications remain steady, but the lender says higher rates could cause "significant drag" on the market.

title: France shooting: Policeman charged over teen's traffic stop death
description: France sees a third night of mass unrest, triggered by Tuesday's police shooting of a teenager.

title: Crisis-hit Pakistan strikes $3bn IMF bailout deal
description: The South Asian nation is facing its worst economic crisis since independence from Britain in 1947.

title: Colosseum: Man who carved names on ancient Rome amphitheatre is UK tourist, Italian police say
description: A man was filmed last week carving names into a wall at Rome's ancient amphitheatre, a world heritage site.

title: Migrant fruit-pickers skilled workers, says ex-minister
description: The former environment secretary says the government is getting it wrong on immigration and skills.

title: Protesters attack Nike store in central Paris
description: Crowds attempted to break into a Nike store, kicking and hitting windows, as violent riots rocked Paris for a third night.

title: Centrica boss warns energy bills will stay high for foreseeable future
description: The boss of Centrica forecasts that household bills will remain high for the foreseeable future.

title: British soldier Shareef Amin returns to Ukraine after life-changing injury
description: Shareef Amin was lucky to survive shrapnel and bullet wounds but is still "going back to help".

title: Harry Potter book bought for 30p could fetch £5,000
description: The book was bought from Wolverhampton libraries by a Lichfield collector, auctioneers say.

title: China tightens Xi Jinping's powers against the West with new law
description: The law underscores China's aggressive diplomacy, but does not guarantee it will take greater actions.

title: How did Annie’s body end up on a Scottish beach?
description: Annie Börjesson's body was found in 2005. Police found no evidence of criminality but loved ones always had questions.

title: King Charles to receive new sword at Scottish ceremony
description: The Elizabeth Sword will be used in an Edinburgh event to mark the coronation of the King and Queen.

title: The Ashes: 'Can England take advantage of Nathan Lyon's absence?'
description: Former England captain Alastair Cook says the second Ashes Test at Lord's is set up "beautifully" and discusses whether the hosts can take advantage of Nathan Lyon's absence.

description: With Wagner's leader sent into exile, where might its thousands of fighters turn next?

title: France: Police presence quadrupled on third night of riots
description: Forty thousand police officers have been deployed as violent protests spread beyond Paris to major cities in France.

title: Chinese spy balloon did not collect information, says Pentagon
description: The balloon floated across the US early this year before being shot down off the South Carolina coast.

title: Pokemon Go maker Niantic cuts a quarter of its workforce
description: The US-based firm says it will also close its studio in Los Angeles and cancel two video game titles.

title: The climate change-denying TikTok post that won't go away
description: The firm is struggling to stop climate misinformation spreading on its platform, BBC investigation finds.

title: BBC Weather shows wrong temperatures after technical glitch
description: Users are being incorrectly shown forecasts in the single figures throughout the coming days.

title: The Papers: Rwanda policy unlawful and 'radical' NHS overhaul
description: A legal ruling on the government's asylum policy and plans to boost the NHS workforce lead the papers.
